title: Tall Sans Serif on Aesthetic Apparatus poster
content:
Greetings,  
Here's another poster from Aesthetic Apparatus, and I'm wondering if anyone knows the font used in SWELL.

Is this an off-the-shelf outline or custom-created?

Thanks, as always!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130402051853im_/http:/typophile.com/files/aafont_6352.jpg)
author: malbright

comments.content: I reckon this is custom, based on [Block Gothic Extra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130402051853/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/red_rooster/block_gothic_extra_condensed/).

This is similar (but not identical to) 'Graphique' - found in R.S. Hutchings Manual of Decorated Typefaces, 1965

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130402051853im_/http:/typophile.com/files/graphique_4646.gif)

Graphique is [available digitally](http://web.archive.org/web/20130402051853/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/artypes/graphique-ar/) from Ari Rafaeli. I  
t may be as close as you can get in a font.

Thanks for pointing me in a good direction.

Cheers.

A little more legwork and I think this font is actually Los Alamos Pro.

Cheers.
